I look forward to the President signing this bill with urgency, as we in the Congress are working on a third, robust legislative package that will continue to prioritize people, businesses — especially small businesses — and families and children.
(5/5)

1240446687249825797.text:
3️⃣ Families’ food security: strengthening nutrition initiatives including SNAP, student meals, seniors’ meals and food banks.
(4/5)

1240446686218145796.text:
2️⃣ Families’ economic security: providing two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of family and medical leave for eligible workers and enhancing Unemployment Insurance. It also supports small businesses by fully reimbursing them for providing leave.
(3/5)

1240446685333028867.text:
1️⃣ Families’ health security: ensuring free coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured. And increase funding for Medicaid to support local, state, tribal & territorial health systems, so that they have needed resources to combat #COVID19
(2/5)

Considerations during the hearing:

1145902432628748288.text: To clarify, the women being held ranged in age, including some in their 50s and 60s. Additionally, 2 of the women we met with suffered from epilepsy. It was heartbreaking on so many levels.

1145864569686020097.text:
"We were able to get into a cell that was holding 15 women -- many of them were crying. They had been 56 days at this border station. They went 9 to 15 days without a shower."

This is a human rights crisis and it has to change -- now. 

https://t.co/uX9dr3HkR6

1145780894508244994.text:
We were met with hostility from the guards, but this is nothing compared to their treatment of the people being held.

The detainees are constantly abused and verbally harassed with no cause. Deprived physically and dehumanized mentally - everyday.

This is a human rights issue.

1145778546998202368.text:
Just left the first CBP facility. The conditions are far worse than we ever could have imagined. 

15 women in their 50s- 60s sleeping in a small concrete cell, no running water. Weeks without showers. All of them separated from their families. 

This is a human rights crisis.

1145777601354641409.text: Every single word of this is true. I am horrified by what I just saw. This should not be a partisan issue — it’s a human rights issue. https://t.co/uRYUsIQGhG

1145725033962266624.text: This is absolutely sickening. We must hold these officials accountable. https://t.co/WnLqyrxiV1

1130944303524655106.text: I take no pleasure in calling for this historic action, and yet I do so with an American sense of optimism — that our government of, by, and for the people is far stronger than a singularly amoral president.

1130944302824198144.text: It is the right time for the committee to launch a formal impeachment inquiry – in parallel with ongoing oversight – to give the American people the truth.

1130944302077620226.text: The President’s outrageous disregard for the law — his cruel and constant corruption — cannot go answered. It will not go unanswered. The American people deserve the truth on the President’s ongoing obstruction of justice, corruption, and abuses of power.

1130944301356208129.text: President Trump and his Administration have obstructed justice over and over again, leaving us no choice: we must open an impeachment inquiry into the President of the United States.

1130944300261478401.text:
Statement on Impeachment Inquiry
THREAD: (1/5) Given countless opportunities to work with Congress — a co-equal branch of government responsible for oversight on behalf of the American people — to get to the truth.

1095351801359056903.text:

This is a fixable problem.
